member.name: T:NHibernate.JetDriver.JetCaseFragment
member.summary:
Jet engine doesn't support CASE ... WHEN ... END syntax, but has a proprietary "Switch".
Author: Lukas Krejci

member.name: T:NHibernate.JetDriver.JetDbCommand
member.summary:
JetDbCommand is just a wrapper class for OleDbCommand with special handling of datatypes needed when storing data into the Access database. These type conversion are performed in command parameters: 1) DateTime, Time and Date parameters are converted to string using 'dd-MMM-yyyy HH:mm:ss' format. 2) Int64 parameter is converted to Int32, possibly throwing an exception.
Because of the diference between the way how NHibernate defines identity columns and how Access does, I have to incorporate another dirty hack here. Because NHibernate does not always use its driver to generate commands (ie. in Schema creation classes), this functionality has to be moved "down" to the IDbCommand object. IMO, everything in NHibernate should call db queries using its drivers, but at the present time it is not true. If it was, we could move the replacing functionality up to the driver class, where it's more appropriate, although it is still a dirty hack :)
Author: Lukas Krejci

member.name: M:NHibernate.JetDriver.JetDbCommand.CheckParameters
member.summary: So far, the only data type I know about that causes Access to fail everytime is DateTime. The solution to the problem is to convert the date to a string representing it.

Dialect for Jet database engine.

member.param: The SqlString that contains the INSERT sql.

member.name: M:NHibernate.JetDriver.JetDialect.Quote(System.String)
member.remarks: MsSql does not require the OpenQuote to be escaped as long as the first char is an OpenQuote.

member.name: M:NHibernate.JetDriver.JetDialect.CreateCaseFragment
member.summary: Create an CaseFragment for this dialect

member.name: P:NHibernate.JetDriver.JetDialect.LowercaseFunction
member.summary: The name of the SQL function that transforms a string to lowercase

member.name: P:NHibernate.JetDriver.JetDialect.IdentityColumnString
member.summary: Access is not conforming to standards of other databases in identity/autoincrement columns specifications. Instead of something like "INT NOT NULL AUTO_INCREMENT" for MySQL or "INT IDENTITY NOT NULL" for MsSQL, Access autoincremented column has a special datatype - COUNTER. This is not compatible with NHibernate way of doing things, so I define some non-SQL string, that is translated in the JetDbCommand..

member.name: P:NHibernate.JetDriver.JetDialect.SupportsLimit
member.summary: Does this Dialect have some kind of LIMIT syntax?

member.name: P:NHibernate.JetDriver.JetDialect.SupportsLimitOffset
member.summary: Does this Dialect support an offset?

member.name: P:NHibernate.JetDriver.JetDialect.SupportsVariableLimit
member.summary: Can parameters be used for a statement containing a LIMIT?

member.name: T:NHibernate.JetDriver.JetDriver
member.summary:
Implementation of IDriver for Jet database engine. Because of the weird JOIN clause syntax, this class has to translate the queries generated by NHibernate into the Jet syntax. This cannot be done anywhere else without having to heavily modify the logic of query creation. The translations of queries are cached.
Author: Lukas Krejci

member.name: M:NHibernate.JetDriver.JetDriver.CreateCommand
member.summary: We have to have a special db command type to support conversion of data types, because Access is weird.

member.name: M:NHibernate.JetDriver.JetDriver.FinalizeJoins(NHibernate.SqlCommand.SqlString)
member.summary:
Jet engine has the following from clause syntax:
tableexpression[, tableexpression]*
where tableexpression is:
tablename [(INNER |LEFT | RIGHT) JOIN [(] tableexpression [)] ON ...]
where the parenthesises are necessary if the "inner" tableexpression is not just a single tablename. Additionally INNER JOIN cannot be nested in LEFT | RIGHT JOIN. To translate the simple non-parenthesized joins to the jet syntax, the following transformation must be done:
A join B on ... join C on ... join D on ..., E join F on ... join G on ..., H join I on ..., J has to be translated as: (select * from ((A join B on ...) join C on ...) join D on ...) as crazyAlias1, (select * from (E join F on ...) join G on ...) as crazyAlias2, (select * from H join I on ...) as crazyAlias3, J

member.name: M:NHibernate.JetDriver.JetDriver.TransformJoinBlock(System.String)
member.param: A string representing one join block.

member.name: M:NHibernate.JetDriver.JetDriver.GetFromPartIndex(NHibernate.SqlCommand.SqlString)
member.returns: index of the sqlPart in sqlString where the "from" part of the sql statement begins or -1 if it doesn't find any.

member.name: M:NHibernate.JetDriver.JetDriver.GetWherePartIndex(NHibernate.SqlCommand.SqlString)
member.returns: index of the sqlPart in sqlString where the "where" part of the sql statement begins or -1 if it doesn't find any.

member.name: T:NHibernate.JetDriver.JetJoinFragment
member.summary:
Jet engine does not support FULL JOINS.
